reason: The PMML XML schema version of exported PMML format models has been upgraded from PMML-4_3 to PMML-4_4.
OneHotEncoder is removed and OneHotEncoderEstimator is renamed to OneHotEncoder.
ImageSchema.readImages is removed and replaced by using spark.read.format('image') for reading images.
The train method with runs parameter is removed, and users should use the train method without the runs parameter.
LogisticRegressionWithSGD is removed and replaced by either LogisticRegression from the ml package or LogisticRegressionWithLBFGS.
The isSorted method is not intended for subclasses to use and has been removed.
RidgeRegressionWithSGD is removed and replaced by LinearRegression with elasticNetParam set to 0.0. The default regParam is 0.01 for RidgeRegressionWithSGD but 0.0 for LinearRegression.
LassoWithSGD is removed and replaced by LinearRegression with elasticNetParam set to 1.0. The default regParam is 0.01 for LassoWithSGD but 0.0 for LinearRegression.
LinearRegressionWithSGD is removed and replaced by either LinearRegression from the ml package or LBFGS.
The getRuns method, deprecated since version 2.1 and having no effect since Spark 2.0, is removed.
The setRuns method, deprecated since version 2.1 and having no effect since Spark 2.0, is removed.
The setWeightCol was not intended for users and has been removed.
The layers parameter type has changed from Array[Int] to IntArrayParam for MultilayerPerceptronClassificationModel.
The numTrees method is removed, and getNumTrees should be used instead.
computeCost method is removed; users should use ClusteringEvaluator instead to evaluate clustering cost/quality.
The precision member variable is removed; use accuracy instead.
The recall member variable is removed; use accuracy instead.
The fMeasure member variable is removed; use accuracy instead.
context method is removed from GeneralMLWriter and replaced with session.
context method is removed from MLWriter and replaced with session.
context method is removed from MLReader and replaced with session.

api: abstract class UnaryTransformer[IN, OUT, T <: UnaryTransformer[IN, OUT, T]]
replaced_by: abstract class UnaryTransformer[IN: TypeTag, OUT: TypeTag, T <: UnaryTransformer[IN, OUT, T]]
reason: UnaryTransformer class signature is changed to include TypeTag for type parameters.
The class and trait hierarchy for logistic regression model summaries changed to accommodate multi-class summaries. Users should replace direct casting with the model.binarySummary method.
OneHotEncoder has been deprecated in favor of the more flexible OneHotEncoderEstimator, which provides a clearer API and will later be renamed to OneHotEncoder.
The default parallelism parameter is changed from the default threadpool size to 1, effectively making computations serial by default.
The learning rate update was incorrect when numIterations was greater than 1, causing different training results between versions 2.3 and earlier.
An edge case bug in multinomial logistic regression which resulted in incorrect coefficients when some features had zero variance has been fixed.
The algorithms now use mid-points for split values, which may result in different model training results.
Fixed the issue where features generated without an intercept were inconsistent with the output in R, potentially changing model training results.
Default value of regParam changed from 1.0 to 0.1.
Fixed inconsistency between Python and Scala APIs for the Param.copy method.
StringIndexer now handles NULL values in the same way as unseen values. Previously an exception would always be thrown.
The method setLabelCol was removed from ChiSqSelectorModel.

replaced_by: Now refers to the Param called numTrees
reason: The numTrees property in RandomForestClassificationModel now refers to the Param called numTrees.

replaced_by: Now refers to the Param called numTrees
reason: The numTrees property in RandomForestRegressionModel now refers to the Param called numTrees.
The model field was removed from LinearRegressionSummary.
The validateParams method was removed from PipelineStage.
The validateParams method was removed from Evaluator.

api: DecisionTreeClassificationModel, GBTClassificationModel, RandomForestClassificationModel, DecisionTreeRegressionModel, GBTRegressionModel, RandomForestRegressionModel
reason: Deprecated all Param setter methods except for input/output column Params.
Fix a bug in ChiSqSelector that changes its result by using pValue rather than raw statistic for selecting top features.
KMeans may return fewer than k cluster centers when k distinct centroids are unavailable or unselected.
The default number of steps for k-means|| initialization mode has been reduced from 5 to 2.
The linear algebra classes were moved to a new package to support DataFrame-based APIs, resulting in the renaming of the Vector class.
The linear algebra classes were moved to a new package to support DataFrame-based APIs, resulting in the renaming of the Matrix class.
Conversion utilities were provided to facilitate migrating from the old vector format in spark.mllib.linalg to spark.ml.linalg.

examples.output: Converts DataFrame vector columns from spark.mllib.linalg to spark.ml.linalg types.

reason: Conversion utilities were provided to facilitate migrating from the old matrix format in spark.mllib.linalg to spark.ml.linalg.

examples.output: Converts DataFrame matrix columns from spark.mllib.linalg to spark.ml.linalg types.

reason: The setScoreCol method in BinaryClassificationEvaluator was removed as part of cleaning up unnecessary methods in the MLlib API.
The weights parameter in LinearRegression was removed as part of API simplification.
The weights parameter in LogisticRegression was removed to streamline the API.
The setMaxNumIterations method was removed as it was marked DeveloperApi and not widely used.
The treeReduce method was removed as these functionalities are now directly available on RDDs and were marked as DeveloperApi.
The treeAggregate method was removed as these functionalities are now directly available on RDDs and were marked as DeveloperApi.
The defaultStrategy method was removed as part of API cleanup to eliminate unused defaults.
The build method was removed to streamline the construction process in tree-based models.
The precision parameter was deprecated in favor of using accuracy to provide clearer metrics.
The recall parameter was deprecated in favor of using accuracy to provide a more consistent metric.
The fMeasure parameter was deprecated in favor of using accuracy to simplify metric presentation.
The 'runs' parameter has been deprecated.
The 'weights' field has been renamed to 'coefficients' to avoid ambiguity with instance weights.
The 'weights' field has been renamed to 'coefficients' to avoid ambiguity with instance weights.

The semantics of 'validationTol' have changed: previously, it was a threshold for absolute change in error. Now, it is similar to 'convergenceTol' using relative error for large errors, and absolute error for small errors (< 0.01).
Previously did not convert strings to lowercase before tokenizing. Now it converts to lowercase by default, with an option not to, matching the simpler Tokenizer transformer.
The method now returns the average regression sum of squares.
The labels are now sorted.
A new default convergence tolerance parameter is set to 1e-3, which may cause iterations to end earlier compared to version 1.4.
Java's varargs support is removed due to a Scala compiler bug.
Added to indicate metric ordering. Metrics like RMSE no longer flip signs as in version 1.4.
The signature of the Loss.gradient method was changed. This affects users who wrote custom loss functions for Gradient-Boosted Trees.
The apply method for the case class BoostingStrategy was changed due to modification in case class fields.
The copy method for the case class BoostingStrategy was changed due to modification in case class fields.
The return value of LDA.run has changed. It now returns an abstract class LDAModel instead of the concrete class DistributedLDAModel. The output type now depends on the optimization algorithm.
The extraneous method solveLeastSquares was removed because it was not essential to the functionality of ALS.
The variance method was replaced with the std method. To compute the column variance values, square the standard deviation values returned by std.

replaced_by: builder pattern using default constructor plus parameter setter methods
reason: The constructor taking arguments was removed in favor of a builder pattern for better configurability of instances.
The variable model is no longer public to restrict access and modify its visibility scope.
The deprecated class method train has been removed, but object/static train methods remain as a replacement.
The checkpointDir parameter has been removed, now requiring the checkpoint directory to be set prior to calling tree and tree ensemble training.
The interface was made private using private[python] to hide it from public use as it was not intended for external usage.
The loss is now divided by 2; hence, the parameters need adjustments. The regularization parameter should be halved, and the step size doubled for consistency.
SchemaRDD has been replaced with DataFrame with a somewhat modified API in terms of structure and usage.
The implicits import moved locations to better modularize the implicit conversions required for conversions.
The output column scoreCol's name was changed to probabilityCol for clarity and to prepare for multiclass classification support.
The intercept is now included in the LogisticRegressionModel; however, with default settings, it is zero.
In MLlib v1.1, the parameter to specify the number of classes was called numClassesForClassification. In MLlib v1.2, it was renamed to numClasses.

examples.output: The named argument for specifying the number of classes has been unified in both Scala and Python to numClasses.

reason: The Node API now includes more information, such as the probability of the predicted label. The output of toString (Scala/Java) and __repr__ (Python) methods has changed from printing the full model to printing a summary.

examples.output: The toString and __repr__ methods now print a summary instead of the full model. Use toDebugString for the full model.

reason: The meaning of tree depth has been changed by 1 to align with scikit-learn and rpart. Previously, a depth-1 tree had 1 leaf node, now a depth-0 tree has 1 leaf node.
The Strategy parameter class is deprecated in favor of the trainClassifier and trainRegressor methods, which explicitly separate classification and regression.

examples.output: Builds a decision tree for classification
Builds a decision tree for regression

reason: In MLlib v1.0, both dense and sparse formats are supported in a unified way, but to fully take advantage of performance enhancements, sparse data should be stored in sparse format instead of dense.
